p: The paraffin-fixed blocks were serially sectioned into 6–7 μm coronal slices and stored at −20 °C. For routine histological studies, paraffin sections were stained with hematoxylin and eosin [ 18]. Hematoxylin–eosin stained sections were analyzed by light microscopy using an Olympus fluorescence microscope (Olympus, Tokyo, Japan). For each rat, we randomly made three HE-staining images. Mammary acinar areas were measured using digital imaging system software MC30 (Mingmei, Guangzhou, China) and all acinar areas were recorded from each rat (1200 acinar areas in total). One-way ANOVA in SPSS 16.0 was conducted to determine differences from the control group. Significant difference was declared at p < 0.05.
